intro: Lomaria boryana, commonly known as the Boryana lomaria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters. Lomaria boryana is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions.
